Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Animal chalice, Grand or Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; exterior, white slipped, glazed (fired red); trace of band in added colour; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The foot of some Mature Animal Style chalices is decorated with concentric added white bands. For parallels, see Lemos nos. 674 and 676 from Pitane. The foot of some Grand Style chalices is decorated with concentric white bands. For parallels, see Lemos no. 800 from Pitane. For parallels regarding Chalice Style chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos no. 938 from Tarentum, no. 952 from Thessaloniki and no. 956 from Istros.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0690) (phase 2)
